verbs.description: [ARG0: Pesident Trump] [V: accused] [ARG1: The New York Times] [ARGM-TMP: on Saturday] [ARG2: of inventing a source for a story who , in fact , was a White House official conducting a briefing for reporters under the condition that the official not be named] .

Pesident Trump accused [ARG0: The New York Times] on Saturday of [V: inventing] [ARG1: a source for a story who , in fact , was a White House official conducting a briefing for reporters under the condition that the official not be named] .

Pesident Trump accused The New York Times on Saturday of inventing a source for a story [R-ARG1: who] , [ARGM-ADV: in fact] , [V: was] [ARG2: a White House official conducting a briefing for reporters under the condition that the official not be named] .

Pesident Trump accused The New York Times on Saturday of inventing a source for a story who , in fact , was [ARG0: a White House official] [V: conducting] [ARG1: a briefing for reporters] [ARGM-MNR: under the condition that the official not be named] .

Pesident Trump accused The New York Times on Saturday of inventing a source for a story who , in fact , was a White House official conducting a briefing for reporters under the condition that the official not [V: be] named .

Pesident Trump accused The New York Times on Saturday of inventing a source for a story who , in fact , was a White House official conducting a briefing for reporters under the condition that [ARG1: the official] [ARGM-NEG: not] be [V: named] .
